alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 6:43AM AKST until January 12 at 1:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility occuring with periods of freezing rain expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Lower Kobuk Valley and Northern Seward Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds and ice accumulation could cause damage to power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow with low visibility is expected to continue this morning then improve in the afternoon as winds decrease. There will be periods of freezing rain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Lower Kobuk Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula
